intro: Eberlanzia parvibracteata, commonly known as the small-bract eberlanzia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying tropical flora.
